intro: Gulubia costata, commonly known as the serrated gulubia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, serrated leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Gulubia costata prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
